Myanmar relief efforts scaled up ten days on
Plan International has scaled up its humanitarian response to meet the needs of children and families impacted by the earthquake in Myanmar.
Read more







7.7 magnitude earthquake strikes in Myanmar
We are working urgently to get additional teams on the ground, assess needs and stand ready to provide support.
Read more







Children in Haiti in danger and out of school because of armed…
Relentless violence in Haiti is robbing children of the chance to attend school and placing them at risk of recruitment by armed groups.
Read more







Attacks against children and all civilians in Gaza must end
Israeli airstrikes overnight have killed at least 300 people, many of them children and women. 
Read more







30 years of uneven progress for adolescent girls
New UNICEF, Plan International and UN Women report highlights that gains have been made for adolescent girls but efforts remain insufficient.
Read more







Humanitarian assistance and access are not tools of warfare
We are profoundly concerned by the recent decision by the Israeli government to suspend all humanitarian aid to Gaza.
Read more







Climate crisis is disrupting girls’ lives in the Sahel…
The climate crisis is disrupting every aspect of young women’s lives in the Sahel.
Read more







Now is the time to stand with girls in all their diversity …
Analysing the impact of changes to US foreign assistance announced over recent weeks, and their consequences for children around the world, especially girls. 
Read more







Three years of war in Ukraine: education disruptions deepen…
Five consecutive years of disrupted schooling in Ukraine is having devastating consequences for children’s development and mental wellbeing.
Read more







Malawi first lady named as Global Girls Foundation ambassador …
Her Excellency Monica Chakwera, First Lady of Malawi, has been appointed as the newest Ambassador of Plan International’s Global Girls Foundation.
Read more







Colombia’s child marriage ban comes into effect
Plan International celebrates as Colombia’s new child marriage law officially comes into effect, raising the legal minimum age for marriage to 18.  
Read more







Plan International condemns Iraq’s legislation enabling child…
The Iraqi government must reconsider amendments to its Personal Status Law and fulfil international human rights treaties.
Read more
